availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Bailey (Logan County, Kentucky physician and soldier)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky physician and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret J.R. Davies Bailey in Logan County, Kentucky on November 5, 1856. Father of Prentice Bailey, Kittie Bailey and Rosie Bailey. Physician in Logan County in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Assistant Surgeon from March 5, 1862 to April 18, 1862. Served in the 26th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Surgeon from April 18, 1862 to.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 2, p. 648.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Hogan, p. 416A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Logan County Marriages, Film #002134965, p. 484 of 1276 of microfilm.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #353510, Certificate #324406.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 374.
Find A Grave, "Dr. James Marion Bailey (1830-1883)," Memorial 101688610, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101688610 (accessed July 31, 2020).
